website_summaries.verdict: A lot of the reviews state that the New Balance Fresh Foam Beacon v2 is an improved version of its predecessor: New Balance Fresh Foam Beacon. Sporting its engineered mesh upper, a lot of the runners have praised the comfort and flexibility offered by the shoe. The employment of the Fresh Foam midsole has also increased the overall comfort of the shoe. Although there have been some comments on its heel slippage, many were still convinced that shoe is still very suitable for long-distance running as it can handle great miles.
pros: A few runners praise the comfort that the Fresh Foam Beacon v2 offers
A lot of the runners commend the lightweight feel the shoe has
The colorway is appreciable, as commented by some wearers
A lot of the runners commend the lightweight feel that this neutral running shoe offers
Even with the presence of the Fresh Foam technology, the shoe still provides enough support and stability with its solid underfoot, a few reviewers commented
The shoe enhances speed, noted one runner
It can be worn for running and casual occasions, remarked some runners
cons: The heel slippage of the shoe is very disappointing, remarked one buyer
Several runners have complained that the shoe does not provide sufficient cushioning

customer_reviews.title: All out Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I run 9-12 miles per week and cross train with a row machine and free weights (Orange Theory) After seeing an article in Runners World listing the NB Beacon V2 as one of the best running shoes I purchased my first pair of New Balance and I’m amazed that I like them better than my Nike Pegasus 36 and Reebok Floatrides. This shoe has an even cushioning and gives stability. No pronating especially when cross training. I love the looks too. You can’t go wrong with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoes but just not for a serious runner.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I wish so much that these had been perfect because they’re the most expensive shoes I’ve ever bought but unfortunately that it not the case. They fit really well for one week but the right shoe started deforming at the toe and the soles of both shoes slip and slides all over the place. I got these to be my main running shoe but now its reserved for short dog walks because the sliding sole is super uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular
customer_reviews.text: I've been running 860's for 5 years or so and I didn't like the v10 so I decided to try something else and these are fantastic. With most shoes I wear a 10 if I can get wides or 10.5 if not. These are perfect for me in 10 wide. Someone else commented that the tread wears quickly. I can't tell how long they will last yet but the sole is this really soft and flexible which makes for a super smooth ride. I don't know if I would like it as much if it were stiff. And really these are for hard surface running, how much tread do you need? Anyway, great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: TeddyZ

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhhh....it’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable, however the insole would slide up my heel overtime and drive me crazy. Had to return I’m going to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D

customer_reviews.title: Not sure this shoe is suitable for over pronated feet.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very comfortable and light. However, and could be my fault, I thought I was buying a shoe that was suited more feet that over pronate. I have noticed that my shoes have that rolled in look which comes from having feet that roll inward. It has happened sooner with this shoe than most shoes I buy. For the most part I am happy with the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: lois rapp

customer_reviews.title: Favorite new shoes with wide toe box!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a YouTube video promoting these and saw that they were on sale. I’m a size 9 wide and recently haven’t been able to run comfortably in regular size 9 shoes—they are too narrow. These were recommended for the wide toebox and they feel amazing. Perfect fit, I like the soft and bouncy foam, super light, and nice heel cup. Great shoes for running when looking for a wider toe box.
customer_reviews.author: aw

customer_reviews.title: Nursing
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nurse and these are GREAT nursing shoes. 13hour shifts on my feet all night are a bit more manageable with these on. They really have a bounce to them. I got the wide ones and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bruna

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Not good build
customer_reviews.text: Fit great. Feel great. Light shoe that I use for mid/forefoot running . I'm 49 , 6'2" 4-5 mile runs every other day at 6:30-7:30/mile pace. Shoe has a major flaw. Ripping at outer edges due to poor design. Wearing out too quickly for the price. Never happened with my Asics over many pairs. Otherwise happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Son loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 14 year old son, and I want some for myself! They are the lightest-weight running shoe I've ever felt. They also look even better than in the pictures, and there was no breaking-in necessary. They were comfortable for him from the first time he wore them. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LeeLeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable running shoes I have had. NB doesn't disappoint. It is very light, certainly compared to my old Nikes. The cushion is just right, it isn't too soft or squishy. Fits well overall, almost like a soccer shoe. If you have a wide foot double check your size. It fits more glove like. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trendy and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has wide, extremely flat feet and New Balance has always been our go to, but you usually are limited on trendy looks with new balance. These are trendy and he said they are very comfortable! That is awesome coming from a man that has constant feet pain. Will order again!!
customer_reviews.author: Garrison Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of this shoe. The heel fits tight and the fabric is very flexible and snug. I like them so much I'd buy another pair. Except the price has already increased since I bought the first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba751

customer_reviews.title: Took 10 day to deliver . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Size runs a bit smaller than expected. Order a half size larger to be safe. Stylish and looks well made. Will take them out for a run and provide and update soon. Deducted 1 star because it took too long to deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Na Kalohe 2011

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I stopped running for a long time as I kept sustaining injuries. So I was a little nervous buying shoes without trying them on first. But this pair fits perfectly. The last pair I bought in a specialty store left me with plantar fasciitis. This pair leaves my feet feeling unfazed by the runs I've taken. I've run a few marathons in the past, so I'm not an absolute stranger to running and shoes. I'm glad to have tried this because now I have finally found the right shoe for me to go back to every few hundred miles.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Gomes

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are really great running shoes. Extremely light yet very supportive with some of the best cushioning. I also bought the New Balance Men's Propel V1 FuelCell Running Shoe - but these are a lot better and worth the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: S.J. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. I prefer the Fresh Foam Roav over these for a run/workout, but these are a great alternative. Very pleased with the look, a little lacking on the ankle supper for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Tripp Spivey

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durabilty
customer_reviews.text: The comfort is great unfortunately the lightweight structure signifantly sacrifices durabilty. I bought these end of April they lasted 4 months of walking only.
customer_reviews.author: Mas

customer_reviews.title: Very light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I started running after this whole quarantine thing happened. I was looking for a very light and comfortable shoe with a lot of cushion. I am really glad this shoe has all these features.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good for working at the Gym, otherwise crappy shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Fit small, wears out quickly and it doesn’t provide the support needed to run. Good for a gym workout only and walking. Would not recommend for runners in the heavier body frame.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A Soriano

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Was a different support than I was use too. But it was a great run and by the end I felt that it was just as good as some $300 running shoes I have.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but runs bigger compared to previous version.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but runs bigger compared to previous version. Durability seems superior compared to the last version but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: W33P

customer_reviews.title: Poor Endurance!!  Treads Already worn out!  Buy a shoe of better quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these shoes for less than 30 days and the treads are already worn out. The construction of the treads of these shoes are of a really poor quality for a running shoe. Was this shoe designed for inside use only?
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I've had in a long while
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fella 280 lb. Bought these cuz I started walking a lot these are so light and very comfortable I bought three pair to walk in and these by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis B

customer_reviews.title: Pop in sound from both side of the sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I noticed now that I’m get a poping sound coming from both side of the sneakers... which can be very annoying
customer_reviews.author: J. CHATEAU

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were great out of the box. Very comfortable and lightweight. However, they wore out very fast and the tread was completely gone after 3 months and less than 135 miles. The fabric on the toe has now started to tear. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: James Warnock

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This New Balance show is pretty comfortable. While wide, it's a tiny bit tight, but because it is so light, I suspect it will stretch a bit. Wears well, and looks sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace L. Mealiea

customer_reviews.title: Tread is disintegrating
customer_reviews.text: After 25 miles of walking on asphalt, the treads started to wear down. Now, after 45 miles, they are completely flat across the ball and out side of my foot. I had to order these shoes twice. They were very narrow the first time so I ordered a triple D. Once I bought the right width and put my own inserts in, they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but can take a beating!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my hubbie's Nikes which he wore heavily for hiking for 4 years until his feet started hurting. He walked for 4miles in 1st day and he reported that his feet felt great afterward!
customer_reviews.author: Moji D. Ariyo

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I’m a New Balance fan, especially the 1080 v9, but these just feel cheap and flimsy. I’m returning and going back to what I like.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Valdes

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is lightweight and very comfortable. Like other reviews have stated, the some wears out wuickly
customer_reviews.author: Heiwana1

customer_reviews.title: My experience- New Balance rock for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: New Balance seem to run wide. I think they’re great and they last!
customer_reviews.author: K Lyon

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for - quality!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put about 100 miles on these so far, one stretch being a half marathon. They are great training shoes. Comfortable toe box, arch support, and reactive cushioned heal. Wonky tongue, but over it. For neutral pronation runners. Mesh upper with blown foam sole make these incredibly light yet durable. Highly recommend for the above average runner. Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: brandon g.

customer_reviews.title: My husbands favorite!
customer_reviews.text: These are husbands favorite. He has two pairs. He says he can sleep in these shoes cause they are super comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Awilda Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, wish the outsole were more durable.
customer_reviews.text: Ran 265 Mike's in this so far, pr'd six times. The only thing I don't like is that the sole wears through quickly. Fits well, good support.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Pinti

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is not very stable. The foot moves too much in the show. The shoe is too audibly squeaky with the foam sole. The shoe is nice and light, but no support and sole will not last.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Starts out great, rubber pods don’t last.
customer_reviews.text: They started out great, bouncy and responsive. Great weight for the high stack height without feeling bottom heavy. Instead of a full length rubber outsole, a few rubber pods were used in high wear areas for traction. Within two months one of these pods has already blown out and peeled off. Pretty disappointing. Without this it would have been 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Marc Massena

customer_reviews.title: High quality running shoe that is reflected in the price
customer_reviews.text: High quality running shoe that is reflected in the price
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Got it !! Like it !! Love them Nicely done shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoe wears quickly and unnaturrally
customer_reviews.text: After only 2 runs, already have noticeable treadwear. Likely unusable after 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: S. S.

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and comfortable with high heel making it easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: victor b norvell

customer_reviews.title: Soles do not last/road only
customer_reviews.text: Fit nicely but soles wore out with less than 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Buy these! Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Expensive, but worth it. I run in these all the time. I will certainly be buying another pair in the future. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy K.

customer_reviews.title: Great ight shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with my new running shoes. Light, easy to slip in and out, great for multiple small runs and walks during the week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Fits perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It fits perfect for me I wear a 9- 9 1/2 in womans and got an 8 in mens. Most comfortable shoe ive ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Dittrich

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, great shoe for sidewalk and street. I run 14 miles a week shoe is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: george zabijaka

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable right out of the box. Incredibly light and look great.
customer_reviews.author: richard j abbott

customer_reviews.title: Fits large
customer_reviews.text: Good for running with great cushion. Fits a bit on the larger side
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and light weight! Very stylish and superb product! Very pleased with this purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Bergerson

customer_reviews.title: Not as v2 advertised  but acceptable similar
customer_reviews.text: Product is Beacon v1 not v2, not a big deal, but should be as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super light
customer_reviews.text: They are supper light! I wear them for tempo run.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great  shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of bounce and almost propels you forward. Looking for another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Read or not to read

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great everyday shoe as well as for the gym or road.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Tilton

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Really comfortable and cushions you feet. Feels nice and supports my ankle well!
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Tan

customer_reviews.title: I like
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfortable for easy runs and tempo days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Run 5 miles 4x a week shoes are awesome for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: sheila harris

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Beacon V2 Fresh Foam Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The New Balance Fresh Foam Beacon v2 men's running shoe offers incredible cushioning in a shockingly lightweight package. For the runner who wants simple, high-performing cushioning, Fresh Foam technology delivers an ultra-smooth ride. The engineered knit upper complements the plush cushioning for a soft-all-over feel.
feature_bullets: Ultra-plush Fresh Foam Ground Contact midsole is supremely lightweight
Soft engineered knit upper features a new Ultra Heel construction for a sleek rearfoot fit
Rubber pods are carefully placed in the high-abrasion heel and toe-off areas
